Description: Two joining fragments of a finger ring, together half of the ring is preserved. It is made of a well smoothed stone in a dark grey to black colour. The body of the ring itself is getting thinner in diameter to the lower end. The ring bezel is relatively flat, half of it is preserved and shows an incised decoration leaving a raised relief with a moon disc and crescent on top of a boat. A further sign like a "t"-hieroglyph to the top left.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 174)
